DG.About.OnlineHelpTooltip: Lancer un navigateur avec l'aide en ligne de GitHub.
DG.About.OnlineBugTracker: Questions, rapports de bug ou demande de developpement.
DG.About.OnlineBugTrackerTooltip: Lancer un navigateur avec l'issue tracker de GitHub.
DG.Physical.FirstAidLabel: Les premiers secours ont déjà été tentés:
DG.Mental.SanityLossIncidentsLabel: Perte de SAN sans devenir fou
DG.Gear.Name: Nom
DG.Bonds.Name: Nom
DG.Tooltip.HP: Points de vie, un personnage devient inconscient à 2PV et meurt à 0PV.
DG.Tooltip.MaximumHP: La Santé maximum est la moyenne de FOR+CON, arrondi au supérieur.
DG.Tooltip.WP: Les Points de Volonté (WP) sont le carburant psychologique. Les Agents ont besoin de Points de Volonté pour continuer à travailler malgré l'épuisement ou les situations mentalement éprouvantes.  Voir la page 47 du Manuel de l'agent pour plus de détails.
DG.Tooltip.MaximumWP: La Volonté maximum est égale au POUVOIR.
DG.Tooltip.SanityLabel: Cliquer pour effectuer un jet de Santé Mentale...
DG.Tooltip.CurrentSanityPartOne: Santé Mentale actuelle, le point de rupture actuel est
DG.Tooltip.CurrentSanityPartTwo: , cliquez sur SAN ci-dessus pour effectuer un jet de santé mentale.
DG.Tooltip.MaximumSanity: La Santé Mentale maximum est égale à 99 moins la compétence Paranaturel.
DG.Tooltip.CannotRollSkillLabel: A skill at 0% cannot be used.  See page 28 of the Agent's Handbook.
DG.Tooltip.SkillFailCheckbox: After failing a test on this skill (if proficiency is at least 1%), check this box. At the end of the session, add 1D4-1 percentage points to the skill and uncheck the box. Does not apply to the Unnatural skill.  See page 29 of the Agent's Handbook.
DG.Tooltip.DistinguishingFeature: Distinguishing Feature (fill out if score is 12 or higher, or 8 or lower).
DG.Tooltip.x5AttributeLabel: Click to roll a x5 check.
DG.Tooltip.FirstAidAttempted: Once an agent receives first aid, they cannot benefit from it again until they receive further damage from a different source.
DG.Tooltip.AdaptedToViolence: Being adapted to violence means your Agent’s empathy suffers as they come to view violence as nothing but another tool to be wielded. He or she permanently loses 1D6 CHA and the same amount from each of their Bonds.
DG.Tooltip.AdaptedToHelplessness: Being adapted to helplessness means your Agent’s personal drive suffers as they pull back from the world around them. As soon as your Agent becomes adapted to helplessness, he or she permanently loses 1D6 POW.
DG.ItemWindow.Bonds.ScoreTooltip: A higher score represents a stronger relationship between the agent and the bond.
DG.ItemWindow.Motivations.DisorderNameTo: A disorder replaces a motivation after hitting a break point.
DG.ItemWindow.Motivations.IsDisorderTool: Check this if adding a disorder, or if an existing motivation has been lost due to gaining a disorder.
DG.ItemWindow.Motivations.DisorderHasBee: A critical success on a therapy luck roll can cure a disorder.  It may return the next time a breaking point is hit however.
DG.ItemWindow.Weapons.LethalityTooltip: A lethal weapon has a chance to instantly kill a target.  Roll a D100 instead of damage die.  If it is not lethal, damage is dealt instead as if the result was a 2d10 roll, with a '00' on the first d10 equaling a 10.
DG.ItemWindow.Weapons.IsLethalityTooltip: Check this if the weapon has a lethality % associated with it.
